thread.title: Jacob Zuma, Africa's Nero?

author: news24.com
title: Jacob Zuma, Africa's Nero?
text:
Where is the voice of our President?
The highest office in the land should be the loudest in condemning the ethos of violence and wanton destruction that appears to grip our nation!Is there a day that goes by without a media report of government, municipal and private property being destroyed in some protest action?
The Government must act to curb the insane obsession with arson lest the Rainbow nation itself is consumed and left a burnt out shell.Of course one must recognise that there is cause for dissatisfaction but this alone cannot justify the violence and destruction .
Grievances should be addressed through discussion and negotiation by which our democracy was achieved. Wasn't peaceful negotiation one of the nation's proudest achievements and for which it has received International recognition and praise?
Democracy brought hope to many along with a say in their future but with it came an obligation to defend it, NOT destroy it!Crime, corruption and incompetence must be fought with all the means at the Government's disposal, failure to do so will lead to irreparable damage to the infrastructure, fabric of society and ultimately to anarchy!
Our constitution and freedom are at stake, to say nothing of the job losses and economic damage caused by such destruction.It is not too late, but the poor, the unemployed, the victims of crime and the nation itself cannot afford, and should not tolerate, leaders who 'fiddle while Rome burns!"
